snippet.title: Alan Jones pokes fun at Sam Armytage on Sunrise
snippet.content:
Alan Jones lets slip on Samantha Armytage's drinking 0:42
Alan Jones has a joke about Samantha Armytage's drinking while talking about the amount the Queen drinks each day. Courtesy: Sunrise/Channel Seven
August 2nd 2017 an hour ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Entertainment - syndicated/
Sam Armytage is stunned by Alan Jones' comment on Sunrise
Share
RADIO king Alan Jones has let slip on Samantha Armytage's drinking habits during a segment on Sunrise this morning. The 76-year-old was live on the Channel Seven show to discuss Queen Elizabeth's alcohol consumption when he called out Armytage. "Quickly, we want to talk to you about the Queen's drinking," Armytage began the discussion. "Each day Her Majesty enjoys a gin and tonic before lunch, there's wine with lunch, a dry martini and a glass of champagne at night. "Now that equals six serves of alcohol, which under British government health guidelines makes her apparently a binge drinker ... Alan."
A post shared by Samantha Armytage (@sam_armytage) on
But Armytage wasn't expecting Jones' hilarious comeback. "Sam, that's light on compared to the last time you and I had dinner," he said. "Honestly, Sam, you started with the gin and it was very straight with not much tonic water at all, you had the white and the red and you topped it up with some champagne. Come on!" Armytage responded: "Alan, this is not about me this is about the Queen."
